snippet: Experts say the draft constitution gives privileged status to institutions that have repeatedly thwarted change during Egypt’s years of revolutionary turmoil.
abstract: Experts warn that draft Egyptian Constitution, appearing to afford citizens important new rights, also gives privileged status to institutions that have repeatedly thwarted change during Egypt's years of revolutionary turmoil; such groups include the police, seen as main instigator of abuses.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: Experts say the draft constitution gives privileged status to institutions that have repeatedly thwarted change during Egypt’s years of revolutionary turmoil.

headline.main: In Egypt Charter, New Rights, but No Great Change
headline.print_headline: In Egypt Charter, New Rights, but No Great Change

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
